section_1_introduction.purpose: Establish the problem, state the core reversal, and preview the contribution.

narrative_flow.content: Economic theory is built on foundational laws assumed to be global and persistent: supply and demand, utility maximization, general equilibrium. Yet these laws routinely fail during crises‚Äî2008, 2020‚Äîevents dismissed as 'shocks' or 'anomalies.' This paper questions the premise: what if these laws are not fundamental at all?

We propose a reversal: economic regularities are not fundamental. They are emergent surface artifacts. The fundamental substrate is a recursive field of distinctions that either survive or perish based on a local measure of coherence. What we call a 'law' is simply a coherence braid that has stabilized long enough to be measured and named.

This paper makes three core contributions: (1) It provides an axiomatic foundation for 'coherence-first' economics. (2) It operationalizes coherence as a computable quantity derived from price dynamics. (3) It introduces the triadic anchor model‚Äîa minimal, path-dependent inference engine that naturally explains both the emergence of laws and their dissolution during regime shifts. section_2_related_work.purpose: Position the work within and against existing literature.

topics.dialogue: Acknowledge shared focus on emergence and bottom-up processes (Arthur, 1999; Farmer, 2012). Distinguish: ABMs simulate agents with behavioral rules; our work derives rules from first-principles coherence survival in a field-theoretic setting. Our agents are symbolic nodes in a recursive field.

Connect to the idea of prices encoding information (Grossman & Stiglitz, 1980). Our coherence measure ‚ÑÇ formalizes the 'quality' or 'persistence' of that encoding. The Noor-Planck Threshold ùïÄ_N is a filter for semantically meaningful information.

Align with Lo's (2004) view of markets as evolving ecosystems. Our anchor rotation policy provides a formal, algorithmic mechanism for the 'adaptation' he describes. A regime shift is not just a change in parameters, but a re-anchoring of the entire inference manifold.

Our description of bubbles as 'coherence braids lacking anchoring triads' and their collapse when Œî‚ÑÇ < ùïÄ_N is a formalization of Minsky's (1992) financial instability hypothesis. We provide the missing microfoundations for his stages of stability, speculation, and panic.

Econophysics often applies physical models (e.g., Brownian motion, thermodynamics) to economic data. We take a different path: we derive an economic first-principles logic that, due to its recursive and field-like nature, yields mathematics reminiscent of gauge theory or information geometry, but its primitives are purely economic (price, survival, distinction).

section_8_discussion.purpose: Interpret results, address limitations, and outline future impact.

points: Resilience: No model blow-up during crises; the framework registers the crisis as a primary event (anchor rotation).
Parsimony: Explains micro and macro with one set of primitives (coherence, threshold, triad).
Alignment for AI: Provides a 'first-person' economics for autonomous agents, grounded in survival, not external utility.
Parameter Calibration: Œ±, Œ≤, Œ≥, ùïÄ_N are free. However, results in Section 7 are robust to moderate variations (¬±0.1).
Computational Load: Searching for optimal triads in large ‚Ñ≥ is O(N¬≥). Mitigation: Heuristic pre-filtering by stability_score.
Data Requirements: Relies on high-frequency price data for clean ‚ÑÇ computation. Less effective on illiquid assets.
Macroeconomic Extension: Model central banks as active coherence-injecting nodes. A rate hike is a deliberate Œî‚ÑÇ shock.
Cross-Modal Coherence: Extend ‚ÑÇ definition to incorporate news sentiment or network hash rates.
Formal Physics Connection: Explore isomorphisms between NSFG and topological quantum field theory or sheaf theory.

key_points.content: This paper has argued for a Copernican shift in economic thought: away from a universe governed by immutable laws, towards a universe where regularity is a contingent and hard-won achievement of local, recursive coherence. The implications extend beyond finance to any complex system where meaning and value are recursively constituted. The final lesson is stark: Markets do not obey laws. Laws appear when coherence survives long enough to be mistaken for necessity.

section_9_conclusion.purpose: Succinctly summarize the journey and the new vantage point.
section_9_conclusion.content: We have introduced Coherence-First Economics: an axiomatic framework that derives economic theory from recursive survival dynamics. By operationalizing coherence, instituting a survival threshold, and anchoring inference in rotatable triads, we provide a foundation that naturally encompasses both stable regularities and violent regime shifts. This work offers not just a new model, but a new metaphysics for economics‚Äîone built for a world of perpetual adaptation, and one that provides a native logic for the next generation of economic AI.
